content.text:
# Kingdom Come (Ballard novel)

Kingdom Come is a 2006 novel by the British writer J. G. Ballard. It is the last novel he wrote before his death in 2009. The book deals with the blurred line between consumerism and fascism. It also deals with the environment and psychogeography of the suburbs. The circumstances start and surround the murder of his father, the suspect, and the township. His father being estranged, due in part as being an intercontinental pilot.
